text: The crisis here is realizing that we all together are somehow responsible, and must discover what to do all together.
I call this the crisis of emptiness â€“ because one must quickly empty oneself of expectations if anything new is to happen.
One cannot "outthink" a crisis; one has to go through it.
If there is pollution in the river of our thought, then we have essentially two strategies we might pursue: removing the pollution from the river downstream, or changing something farther upstream.
People tend to collide and smash into one another.
Human beings have a great deal of repressed hatred and violence in them.
"I am not my point of view." I have a point of view, but that is not what I am.
While I may have a position, I am also a person with a history, a particular background, and none of this am I now seeking to hold back. .
